name: Donair Power Bowl
description: Power Bowls are perfect for meal prep. This one is a great way to use up leftover Donair and then simply assemble with a cooked grain, sliced veggies, and a dressing! You’ll have enough bowls for lunches for the work week.

ingredients.name: East Coast Donair Sauce or Dillicious Tzatziki
head romaine or leafy green lettuce

preparation: For dressing, in a small bowl, whisk together aioli, hot water, and sugar, if using. Set aside.
Chop tomatoes. Using Y Peeler, peel cucumbers lengthwise into ribbons. Cut onion in half; thinly slice.
Divide quinoa, veggies, and donair between five bowls. Drizzle with dressing and sprinkle with topper, if desired.
tips: Prepare a large batch of quinoa in the Multipurpose Steamer. Combine 2 cups uncooked quinoa with 4 cups water or broth. Microwave on high, uncovered, 20–22 min, stirring halfway through. Quinoa should be tender. Set aside to cool. Gently fluff with a fork before serving. This recipe yields about 5 cups quinoa (perfect for this power bowl recipe!).
Tomatoes are so delicious at this time of year. Switch it up and try cherry tomatoes, which come in a variety of shapes and colours; simply slice in half and add to your bowls.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: This is a perfectly balanced plate.

products.name: Donair Seasoning (Pack of 3)
summary: Any way you name it – gyro, shawarma, donair, or doner kebab – our Donair Seasoning is what you’re looking for. You won’t believe how easy it is to make the street food staple at home in minutes with this blend and a few simple ingredients. Just add the seasoning to ground beef, press it into a Rectangular Steamer and cook it in the microwave for 10 minutes or the oven for 60. Slice thinly and serve on a pita with fresh veggies and tzatziki – dinner is done!

products.name: Lemon Dilly Dip Mix
summary: Beyond being one of our most-loved kid-friendly dips – they love it for dunking chicken strips, fish bites, and veggies – Lemon Dilly is all about versatility. With loads of dill and a hint of lemon zest, it makes an utterly delicious tzatziki and spread for burgers and sandwiches, and levels up everything from salad dressing and salmon to pasta and vegetables.
